+0000","feedId":6128,"bgimg":"https://dab1nmslvvntp.cloudfront.net/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/1583709471npm.png","linkMd5":"cbe9e6892fc9c91abd4b5fa6a8c29685","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn9@2020_4/2020/08/24/22-51-24-675_97255383d1af1caa.webp","destWidth":600,"destHeight":339,"sourceBytes":9184,"destBytes":9184,"author":"Michael Wanyoike","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://dab1nmslvvntp.cloudfront.net/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/1583709471npm.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn9@2020_4/2020/08/24/22-51-24-675_97255383d1af1caa.webp","https://dab1nmslvvntp.cloudfront.net/wp-content/uploads/2015/03/1426064914package_manager-1024x682.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn91@2020_2/2020/08/24/22-51-45-523_816ae029aa6a1383.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/SitepointFeed?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn15@2020_1/2020/08/24/22-51-39-311_6409ebad5acff93a.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/SitepointFeed?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn3@2020_5/2020/08/24/22-51-47-113_bf83e999bebef320.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/SitepointFeed?i=tb6a7jv_MiY:WoxI1ddprjI:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn80@2020_2/2020/08/24/22-51-47-022_ca9186a433e29e44.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/SitepointFeed/~4/tb6a7jv_MiY":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn27@2020_1/2020/08/24/22-51-40-045_bf837bd083ef8108.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598309483297},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 06:51:23","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 06:51:23","title":"JavaScript setTimeout() Function Examples","link":"http://www.sitepoint.com/?p=104008","description":"<a href=\"https://www.sitepoint.com/javascript-settimeout-function-examples/?utm_source=rss\" title=\"JavaScript setTimeout() Function Examples\" rel=\"nofollow\"> <img class=\"webfeedsFeaturedVisual\" style=\"display: block; margin: auto; margin-bottom: 5px;max-width: 100%;\" link_thumbnail=\"1\" src=\"https://dab1nmslvvntp.cloudfront.net/wp-content/uploads/2015/08/1476830355set_timeout_2-01.png\" alt=\"jQuery setTimeout() Function Examples\" srcset=\"https://dab1nmslvvntp.cloudfront.net/wp-content/uploads/2015/08/1476830355set_timeout_2-01-300x167.png 300w, https://dab1nmslvvntp.cloudfront.net/wp-content/uploads/2015/08/1476830355set_timeout_2-01-768x427.png 768w, https://dab1nmslvvntp.cloudfront.net/wp-content/uploads/2015/08/1476830355set_timeout_2-01.png 900w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /> </a> \n<p><strong><code>setTimeout</code> is a native JavaScript function (although it can be used with a library such as jQuery, as we’ll see later on), which calls a function or executes a code snippet after a specified delay (in milliseconds). This might be useful if, for example, you wished to display a popup after a visitor has been browsing your page for a certain amount of time, or you want a short delay before removing a hover effect from an element (in case the user accidentally moused out).</strong></p> \n<p><img class=\"aligncenter size-full wp-image-141586\" src=\"https://dab1nmslvvntp.cloudfront.net/wp-content/uploads/2015/08/1476830355set_timeout_2-01.png\" alt=\"set_timeout_2-01\" width=\"900\" height=\"500\" loading=\"lazy\" /></p> \n<p><em>This popular article was updated in 2020.</em></p> \n<h2 id=\"basicsettimeoutexample\">Basic setTimeout Example</h2> \n<p>To demonstrate the concept, the following demo displays a popup, two seconds after the button is clicked.</p>  \n<p class=\"codepen\" data-height=\"300\" data-theme-id=\"6441\" data-slug-hash=\"Ejxvjr\" data-default-tab=\"result\" data-user=\"SitePoint\" data-pen-title=\"Delayed Magnific Popup modal\" data-preview=\"true\">See the Pen <a href=\"https://codepen.io/SitePoint/pen/Ejxvjr/\">Delayed Magnific Popup modal</a> by SitePoint (<a href=\"https://codepen.io/SitePoint\">@SitePoint</a>) on <a href=\"https://codepen.io\">CodePen</a>.</p> \n<p><script async=\"\" src=\"https://static.codepen.io/assets/embed/ei.js\"></script></p> \n<p>If you don’t see the popup open, please visit <a href=\"http://codepen.io/SitePoint/pen/Ejxvjr/\">CodePen</a> and run the demo there.</p> \n<h2 id=\"syntax\">Syntax</h2> \n<p>From the <a href=\"https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/WindowOrWorkerGlobalScope/setTimeout\">MDN documentation</a>, the syntax for <code>setTimeout</code> is as follows:</p> \n<pre><code class=\"javascript language-javascript\">var timeoutID = scope.setTimeout(function[, delay, arg1, arg2, ...]);\nvar timeoutID = scope.setTimeout(function[, delay]);\nvar timeoutID = scope.setTimeout(code[, delay]);\n</code></pre> \n<p>where:</p> \n<ul> \n <li><code>timeoutID</code> is a numerical ID, which can be used in conjunction with <a href=\"https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/WindowOrWorkerGlobalScope/clearTimeout\">clearTimeout</a> to cancel the timer.</li> \n <li><code>scope</code> refers to the <a href=\"https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Window\">Window interface</a> or the <a href=\"https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/WorkerGlobalScope\">WorkerGlobalScope interface</a>.</li> \n <li><code>function</code> is the function to be executed after the timer expires.</li> \n <li><code>code</code> is an alternative syntax that allows you to include a string instead of a function, which is compiled and executed when the timer expires.</li> \n <li><code>delay</code> is the number of milliseconds by which the function call should be delayed. If omitted, this defaults to 0.</li> \n <li><code>arg1, ..., argN</code> are additional arguments passed to the function specified by <code>function</code>.</li> \n</ul> \n<p><em>Note: the square brackets <code>[]</code> denote optional parameters.</em></p> \n<h3 id=\"settimeoutvswindowsettimeout\">setTimeout vs window.setTimeout</h3> \n<p>You’ll notice that the syntax above uses <code>scope.setTimeout</code>. Why is this?</p> \n<p> Continue reading <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://www.sitepoint.com/javascript-settimeout-function-examples/?utm_source=rss\">JavaScript setTimeout() Function Examples</a> on <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://www.sitepoint.com\">SitePoint</a>. </p>\n<div class=\"feedflare\"> \n <a
